title: Regression and Correlation
content:
Module 8, Lesson 10: Regression and Correlation

Introduction

This lesson covers Regression and Correlation within the broader study of Statistics. Mastering these concepts will give you a solid foundation for subsequent lessons and real-world applications.

Key Concepts

1. Core Definitions

We begin with precise definitions that form the bedrock of Regression and Correlation. A rigorous understanding of terminology prevents ambiguity and enables exact communication and proof.

2. Fundamental Theorems and Results

The central theorems of Regression and Correlation provide powerful tools for solving problems. We state each result clearly, explain the intuition behind it, and work through representative examples.

3. Worked Examples

Each concept is illustrated with step-by-step worked examples. Pay close attention to the reasoning at each step — it is as important as the final answer.

4. Common Misconceptions

Students often confuse closely related ideas in Regression and Correlation. We highlight these distinctions explicitly so you can avoid common errors in exams and practical work.

Summary

You have completed the study of Regression and Correlation in Module 8 (Statistics). The key ideas covered in this lesson will be built upon in subsequent lessons. Attempt the quiz to consolidate your understanding before moving on.

quiz.question: The p-value is:
options: The probability of observing the data (or more extreme) given H₀
